9DA4163EFCB94668B19895658020A2BB.description: Determine if formal or informal speech is appropriate in the context of a given situation

CE8B4BA9C01B41B29F78C5C6839C264A.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of
formal English when indicated or appropriate. (See grade 8 Language standards 1 and 3
on page 53 for specific expectations.)

5FE14E0711204B40B59549BA670EBBB9.description:
Determine when to integrate multimedia and visual display to clarify information and
strengthen claims and evidence and add interest

C0151BBDC10A4484BCA058B8B44803AC.description:
Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information,
strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

04ED5390101E482E810E497F67CC244B.description: Demonstrate appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation

8EF5CACD98A04557B7AE5C99681DF549.description:
Determine salient (key) points, relevant evidence,sound valid reasoning and well-chosen
details to support claims

37B1E2E616A048DF80A5ABDBBD6D82C2.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent
manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details; use
appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

E62BDEBE16F049E3A3F84DBCE7992D48.description: Evaluate the evidence for sound reasoning, relevancy and sufficiency

E4656ECB9F354151A8B3CB654256122F.description: Analyze a speaker’s argument and specific claims

A7A0CD253DF146D9B4C3E34B094FF40B.description:
Define and identify a speaker's sound reasoning, arguments, relevant and sufficient
evidence and claims

201F41AEDA9344D89057A90BBDC30504.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of
the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and identifying when
irrelevant evidence is introduced.

47CB698B8F784F93863664C809137A9A.description: Evaluate the motives behind the presentation of the information

69702B3B8AC24CFC94DFE46E69735FE0.description: Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media formats

556D97685A504EE981FD281941E2B2B0.description:
Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g.,
visually, quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial,
political) behind its presentation.

FC97408E9F6443338F0438628BEF3B36.description:
Acknowledge new information posed and use evidence to qualify or justify personal
viewpoints

28C7C172A50C43E08C829E288252835B.description: Evaluate new information and personal views, as well as the views of others

85488BB3F94D4891B90BE18A4299C0B9.description: Evaluate personal views and the views of others

9E8BDEAA7D084FA4881A0A4595E4A738.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, qualify
or justify their own views in light of the evidence presented.

B296197C97ED4551AA11E2D3710927BF.description: Respond to questions and comments with relevant details

B7478205D935460882681CD6CC904ADF.description: Pose relevant questions that connect the ideas of several speakers

AF1D8B6F8A624FE598F78E217956E974.description:
Formulate comments, questions, and responses based on evidence, observations, and
ideas

AD2EA66D30A04BF3BC159EA1686B02D2.description:
Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others’
questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

9FFC55214D0447DD980C4425E03DF601.description: Track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, defining individual roles as needed

408ED056606C4AC5AC755280CB2DB6CB.description: Describe components of a collegial discussion and planning

C49A5496CCB04CEAAC62E4B5E887E80E.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making, track progress
toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

281629CC174F40BBA3BC6EA1B2CFA678.description: Analyze prepared materials to probe and reflect ideas to advance the discussion

929953EFD1AE40AD98A1D15F6B52EA46.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups,
and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on
others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

040435D5E85F4796A7D917943B33BD3E.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or
phrase important to comprehension or expression.

FFABF3B1CAB149B59DE788412847D261.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar
denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

F4AB21BD28434DD78CA8D46A0DDD2A25.description:
Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the
words.

85B368A46D9B4D34BCDB47AE91FB4018.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

7566A3AD28AE42D78AD048053FED75DA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and
nuances in word meanings.

A2D67F9B7C5D426E9037574F9BB73EB3.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by
checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

6CB57B18C2FF4D9DA17273A1252D54CF.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or
determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

ABE535A179264768B57578B362B5206F.description:
Explain the meaning of a word or phrase by using common Greek and Latin affixes and
roots

963A3DE868EE49DA9FB95E45E6246901.description: Identify common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots

02CE0DAD4DD942CBA5E5FBF224F433D1.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the
meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

7862B899CC02430AA42681A29E64581B.description: Identify context clues that determine words or phrases position or function in a sentence

FCEB1391A82E4C0983A6A35AB178126D.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s
position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

9EA6C2CC87104D4C9BF883D1383A70A5.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or
phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of
strategies.

2308E249700246379F5E5C1570CAF733.description: Determine when to use verbs to achieve particular effects

3C7A19B0B14148628BD537AA6505353D.description: Identify when verbs are in conditional and subjunctive mood

A654049A506B4B0FB4FD6CEC6B29BA56.description: Identify when verbs are in active or passive voice

4E7651A2908D457484AE4F69256F49C0.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or
listening

EF4A92ED35554B45BF5CC11B7DCCF49E.description: Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.

CBB2227F8A1B405AB4E2DC28DD5660E8.description: Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

AB7A5DDAB9BA466C96E634390D0CBD34.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization,
punctuation, and spelling when writing.

0D2F5639EF6E46D593E809FE38FC700E.description: Identify inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood

CAC5516ABDE54B5A9D5CEC65C0F6C048.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

F62B3269B85C48398016D67FE80163A7.description:
Identify verb moods such as indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and
subjunctive

C2769FBF4E3D4B0CA352B15B65EFCD83.description:
Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and
subjunctive mood.

030448FAB7454409A7D0D3724CC46BAD.description: Identify verbs in active voice and passive voice

B9AF00E1F03447D4A06EC635C5956646.description: Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

13DFC3D8B49F4617A820961F6A8F83E3.description: Identify verbals such as gerunds, participles, and infinitives

8AC7942FBEFC45148FD5154FC8CCF1E8.description:
Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and
their function in particular sentences.

95E5119F1A984FF5BD4621949E8F5FD8.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage
when writing or speaking.

0E5EFF882DA74798970390AD0821582E.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of disciplinespecific
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

E5755EA0846944F0B857A55E95890EC4.description:
Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and
evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the
reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when
irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

C654E01D390D44789C78C740ED0E658C.description:
Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work
of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths,
traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how
the material is rendered new”).

F297BBC01C7B462190E37DEA1C67E985.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research.

6EB4CF72E65142419117BD30FE44E88F.description: Quote or paraphrase the data conclusions of others and avoid plagiarism

A07FEEEA374C4FFB86AFE89E3ADFD7C0.description: Assess the credibility and accuracy of a source

C149E3A6BF524775BA749B067B8A5F1E.description: Determine the relevance of information gathered from print and digital sources

9FD46A16C9A84822A0DF64A3EAE45D3A.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search
terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or
paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation.

CB80E3B5A8674B21AFE02E614B69775D.description:
Conduct short research projects that generate focused questions that allow for multiple
avenues of exploration

6380F9A9CA224C1E852F71B58C09C94E.description: Formulate questions that would allow for other avenues of exploration

0B8B5E90B2E44E388FD7A6D7FB8BCB42.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated
question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused
questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

05E8D615DE044AF59A4D8E99F09A8958.description: Use technology to interact and collaborate with others

227694E51F764B6EB1B452F3A1D27E03.description: Use technology (Internet) to produce, revise, edit, and publish writing

7F3E4865A286495B93AF9399C9F88628.description:
Determine the best technology options for communicating and collaborating with others
for an intended purpose

E09D58A64D7041278D5189F56ABCDF82.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present
the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and
collaborate with others.

E20A5F66C17C41CC9858CB5817C0D21E.description: Determine how well the focus of the purpose has been addressed

F576FA2C157140ABBDC84CA60190A38F.description: Recognize how to try a new approach

E4C6BF0F09E6413AA4525CE822383804.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen
writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach,
focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for
conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and
including grade 8.)

55D3AC069AB946669324441E6438F5E3.description: Integrate the reason for writing to decide the task, purpose, and audience

E2E6BD2625B9465AA13A169543C1091A.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and
style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for
writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

FF5216E4115C48D0916C0FE200B7B79F.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or
events.

C550E53655CC48F1827CE8F5B5BD6A55.description:
Use precise, descriptive, and sensory language to capture the action and to develop
experiences and events

3C5FF2ADB1924AEA88874CB8B1678357.description:
Identify how writers use precise words/phrases, descriptions, and sensory details to help
readers visualize or sense action

FBB0DCDC90454651B0AB9AFF04A90A67.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory
language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

752847911E2E45D9BA170C45D0FEFE29.description: Use a variety of transitions to shift from one setting to another

CAB111BED27043AEA4F19C161805C18E.description: Analyze the relationships among experiences and events

999723B09C0649149578BC1AEEB6E7A8.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence,
signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships
among experiences and events.

78D8955B55FB41A69E847ED4FEC2EC6F.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to
develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

1771E1F06EA0422B92DC0FA012C9920C.description: Design and organize event sequences that unfold naturally and logically

FA0BF259DEB44D4DA42BD9344C4F3D6E.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and
introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds
naturally and logically.

DF06A91C854844EC85333DD730C8DD5D.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

1899485AEF064E14BF55E564D2B4C208.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the
information or explanation presented.

9CF167D848A44C52B37C9CD6D3541DC8.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

01DF0CDC109A442D813E47DE05C2C9AE.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain
the topic.

1F266ED603424E8DAC533145145796F6.description:
Integrate appropriate and varied transitions to clarify relationships between ideas and
concepts and create cohesion

31CD29648288483BAC9E162A5037F3A4.description: Select appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify relationships

5BCB3268ECBE4A1898EBFB4CF0B95F0D.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the
relationships among ideas and concepts.

061697DD77624FB8BBC13A3289A43638.description:
Develop a topic using definitions, concrete details, quotations, examples, and other
information

D64D77C58B354C839A3F217FD5083226.description:
Analyze and organize relevant content using facts, definitions, concrete details, and
quotations to develop the topic

DD52708E51E74048AD3AFC6D6A911ED6.description:
Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and examples.

4ACD8231271C4F1B8E58D522E430A561.description: Apply formatting, graphics, and multimedia to aid comprehension

ACB8444684C24855A20B2ECCFB86B87C.description: Organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories

4BCF4B297B274AD796B0C37D99498275.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts,
and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings),
graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding
comprehension.

DAF020466C3548DB86C7C907C26EADF3.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts,
and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

B597101A0E084222A572CB7723E8A14D.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the
argument presented.

19A3B0856D3940C99386BA4B41B33B8B.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

7930F1DF5A2E445D9DC5C6F9692352AC.description:
Create cohesion and clarify relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and
evidence

D29E7E9EDE6848CF93F0AC31D8B10FCA.description: Identify and explain phrases and clauses that create cohesion and clarify relationships

C1A81E9F33D44C9B869FA7D86064532E.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships
among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

FAC91CA9DB0C4B21BA68C7B799EFED12.description: Provide support for claims by distinguishing between relevant and irrelevant evidence

2D36F56D7DB441CE87EE57275E9FC872.description: Provide support for claims using logical reasoning and relevant evidence

148008E1BA934F24AD727573E9AE0EB9.description: Evaluate sources for credibility and accuracy

F7B3D614B163459DA7DEF414B7E7F043.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate,
credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

27B4CD0D583942B7BFB32DCAD4D6C1B8.description: Determine how to introduce claims and acknowledge alternate or opposing claims

E80294626F5D4485B0DA1343CC8D70B9.description: Identify and explain alternate, counter, or opposing claims

106ACD1C9C5D4312AD8F6B2317ACF9B9.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or
opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

4D59497007474E18B259C2029EEA467C.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

F905363547AA4306A9641A1CAB6B3B25.description:
Read nonfiction literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and
proficiently

E380C1BD068F4C59A3AB02D091B3F2B5.description:
Comprehend nonfiction literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently
and proficiently

5567B49DC118491CB9D4CA6500D7CBDD.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction at the high end of
the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

3AA66FD737514E729845424C9895D570.description: Read literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and proficiently

7D3C0EF9217C46A89E36F36FF6BCA95E.description:
Comprehend literature in the grades 6-8 text complexity band independently and
proficiently

8FE2EEC5FBD145F1B91A41F12D7FD85D.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature including stories, dramas,
and poems, at the high end of grade 6-8 text complexity band independently and
proficiently.

FAF35A8CD11D4BFC8F571608A91BE3C9.description:
Analyze two or more informational texts for conflicting information as to how the texts
disagree in facts or interpretation

0265132D700D4F8C9F15FF0A29BA069C.description: Identify criteria for analyzing informational texts

4BECAC72B25A4177A2525B6C6322BEA9.description: Recognize facts or interpretations in informational text

FB8FAE4C413A4AAE9730A401E3FD6FEA.description: Identify differences or conflicting information between two informational texts

AC81DBF1A93B4847B26EA0FE1A8AD79F.description:
Analyze a case in which two or more text provide conflicting information on the
same topic and identify where the texts disagree on the matters of fact or interpretation.

358041023A574F9D91C837296B6AEC40.description:
Evaluate an argument in a text based on sound reasoning, relevance, and sufficient
evidence in informational text

16E1AA11BC3941ECB0A97919E1DC6A8B.description: Delineate the argument and specific claims of informational text

85A1F39C3B914FB3AF3F48468383C394.description: Recognize irrelevant evidence in an argument

4BD4C11C5010418EB478A723F1FC9B60.description: Identify the argument and claims in an informational text

79347F05297C429FABC781BAA0878A51.description: Identify relevant, sufficient evidence and sound reasoning in an informational text

B20944CB69894FD2AF9BE5134442B8CC.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing
whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize
when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

8345FB243757447C8785EEFB72504B4A.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using multimedia in an informational
presentation

AA29BD04CB904E6E9230F019F1F4FADC.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using video in an informational
presentation

BBC8BBE8AFFD4956AD9A949FC1A86334.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using digital in an informational
presentation

A6B692FA076748FEA1265E137646FE63.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using print in an informational
presentation

50C573E8CA294F82812EAB66905BBE1F.description:
Identify different mediums including print, digital, video, and multimedia in informational
text

2F94163A982E41CEB53B70450B1A6E01.description:
Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print
or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

35F1DD1F96BD48EF9DD1A335AFC6F503.description: Evaluate how myths, traditional stories, or religious works are rendered new

F8C524640ED14843A53825B2BA795C16.description:
Compare and contrast character types in modern fiction to myth/traditional story/religious
work

9E7128FE4CA54138B606014D71A0CABE.description:
Compare and contrast patterns of events in modern fiction to myth/traditional
story/religious work

2EBCAD70C13F453B9B00499D180948AF.description: Compare and contrast themes in modern fiction to myth/traditional story/religious work

920C310AE10142B080CC7E223043B377.description:
Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or
character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible,
including describing how the material is rendered new.

0DB0E93347884ED6980A22172135A3AB.description: Evaluate the outcome/impact of choices made by directors and actors

E4CE0F9B43A84D9F98BA97C6C6586840.description:
Analyze the faithfulness or departure between the text of a story or drama and the live or
filmed production

BEA6811BED7343FBA4D1B12A7922B176.description: Compare and contrast the text of a story or drama and the live or filmed production

08645EA4023E4CF785C7EEB87F9D9C48.description: Recognize choices directors and actors make

FD04BBA4D03E4547B689326B3EDED968.description:
Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays
faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director
or actors.

8228D1A496594F2DA6E2F028603CA50A.description:
Analyze the techniques the author uses to acknowledge and respond to conflicting
evidence

36AAED5E9A86413480E9837CAC1495DC.description: Identify conflicting evidence or viewpoints presented in a given text

75C9BA7452BA4F30942A73139827C749.description: Identify evidence the author uses to support his/her viewpoint or purpose

86EBBB8153AA4984A5ADF10F6D53D43E.description: Recognize the author’s point of view or purpose

E05640D431334880A515A362BA80722B.description:
Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author
acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

2B3D313A980A4E8D8EE5C36D7394E9C4.description: Analyze the structure of specific sentences in developing a paragraph

BF699322D06842AC92D947CCB0DA322B.description:
Analyze the role that a particular sentence plays in developing and refining the key
concept

91BB06FDD11E417690EBE29121005D9C.description: Identify the structure of a specific paragraph in an informational text

D0DCD970BD0A41C79622D6BE02C64B77.description:
Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of
particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

E4A0408688D84944AAEEF76337E1D7A5.description: Analyze the impact of analogies and allusions on the meaning and tone of other texts

113FE62BA8B54E53931A9C635F346D43.description: Analyze the impact of word choice on meaning and tone

ABB904DC08BE4C3E8B6232B56E81DC11.description: Determine the meaning of figurative, connotative, and technical words and phrases

E3778009F4F643DE80C53C3392E347DA.description: Identify words and phrases that include analogies and allusions to other texts

A9CA400EF9BD4A8FA8213F7E11AAA33E.description: Identify figurative, connotative, and technical words and phrases

01A0A8C7F8594BD8A479919F1C875133.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative. connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word
choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

8CC0171781CD448E863BD725A4F3DEA9.description: Analyze the techniques the author uses to respond to conflicting evidence

2BCFCAC1C91F4AFDBB83A78EC5E4E443.description:
Compare and contrast the author’s evidence and/or viewpoints to conflicting evidence
and/or viewpoints

CB1EE52029E84825851DB0540F9F209E.description: Identify conflicting evidence or viewpoints presented in a given text

27F1EB9A1200462B804759B8BC6C54C5.description: Identify evidence the author uses to support his/her characters’ viewpoint/purpose

34DE090CCFEF4506ADE9521FFA9AED20.description: Determine the author’s point of view or purpose

F90E762593DE4D62B2815AF4C0D607FF.description:
Analyze how difference in the points of view of the characters and the audience or
reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense
or humor.

EC15BA0F4D6B47A79F78D44C97345ECE.description: Analyze how the structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style

3F7BE6C826374D78B56C935F8C0A0316.description: Compare and contrast the structure of two texts

3087ACDB70CB4FC3954F01E5B4A196AB.description: Identify structural elements of two or more texts

9BA0C1D5469E4E6786CBE4BE3C8621F5.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the
differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

1F4B49456A07460DA4C4AC933B4D1DC5.description: Analyze the impact of word choices, analogies, and allusions on meaning and tone

F1A63F51F67F402E89483C56624F306A.description:
Determine the figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases as they are
used in the text

Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including
figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on
meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Analyze how individuals, ideas, and events are connected through comparison,
analogies, or categories

Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between
individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

text

Recognize the difference between explicitly stated and inferred information in
